text: I used to love this, but not anymore. If you're about to watch it, you need a doctor.

Ok because it is about this emoji called Gene and he doesn’t think he is very popular and there is this kid called  Alex and he likes this girl called Addie and he thinks his phone is acting weird and there is this evil emoji called smiler and she wants to delete Gene and he meets this other emoji called high-five and this hacker called jailbreak but it reveals that she is actually a princess  ok movie 6/10

From the very first second, I felt my soul leave my body. 💀
This wasn’t a movie — it was a 💣 corporate fever dream, a tragic fusion of 💩, 📱, and 😭 pain.

They took something as harmless as emojis — our tiny digital friends! — and turned it into a two-hour advertisement for despair. 🤑
The plot? Nonexistent. The characters? Emotionally hollow. The jokes? So bad they made me question the concept of humor itself. 😐

Gene the “meh” emoji was the perfect metaphor — not because he was relatable, but because I was also meh for 86 agonizing minutes. 😩
The pacing felt like watching a buffering YouTube video on 1% battery. 🔋🐢

Every frame whispered: “This was made by a marketing team, not artists.” 💔
By the time the credits rolled, I was staring into the void, wondering how a film could make Pixels look like Citizen Kane. 😵‍💫

Final Verdict: 💩💩💩💩💩 out of ⭐️
This wasn’t a movie. It was a crime against cinema. 🎭🔥
I Did Not Like This Movie, Because... IT'S THE WORST ANIMATED MOVIE FROM 2017 EVER EXISTED IN THE WHOLE WORLD!!!!! 😡😡😡😡😡👎👎👎👎👎

The Emoji Movie is a disappointing attempt to cash in on smartphone culture without offering any real heart, humor, or originality. The story feels forced and predictable, the jokes rarely land, and the constant product placement makes it feel more like a long commercial than a film. Even the talented voice cast can’t save the shallow script or the lifeless animation. Overall, it’s a soulless, emoji-filled mess that fails to connect with kids or adults — a movie that should have stayed in the drafts folder.
Why did I even rate this…?
my daughter says: its a fine movie but not safe for kids...some parts are kind of inappropriate this is a nightmare for adults... never ever let your kids watch it.
Nowhere near as bad as it is made out to be, but still it’s obviously trying to copy Inside Out with much less emotional depth and worse story.
Do I even need to explain?
If you want to keep your sanity intact, don’t watch this movie.

I do have some positive things to say about The Emoji Movie:|
Pros:
Decent and colorful animation (while bland)
Some actors tried their best
Good soundtrack

Cons:
Horrible writing and storytelling
Rips off so many good films
Hatable characters
Unnesscary mean-spirited tone
Forced message
Souless product placement everywhere
Animation (while decent) is bland and sometimes uncreative
Some of the voice acting is pretty bad

3/10
